background: A senior home is scheduling the intake of spinach and soybeans for elderly to meet certain nutritional fibre and iron requirements while maximizing caloric intake.
constraints: Number of cups of spinach is non-negative
Number of cups of soybeans is non-negative
Number of cups of spinach must exceed the number of cups of soybeans
Total intake of fibre must be at least TotalFibre units
Total intake of iron must be at least TotalIron mg
objective: Maximize the seniors' total caloric intake from cups of spinach and soybeans
description: A senior home has snacks of spinach and soybeans to increase their intake of iron. A cup of spinach contains \param{FibreSpinach} units of fibre and \param{IronSpinach} mg of iron. A cup of soybeans contains \param{FibreSoybeans} units of fibre and \param{IronSoybeans} mg of iron. Due to other nutritional requirements, the nurses decided that the number of cups of spinach must exceed the number of cups of soybeans. Furthermore, a cup of spinach contains \param{CaloriesSpinach} calories while a cup of soybeans contains \param{CaloriesSoybeans} calories. If they schedule that the elderly need in total at least \param{TotalFibre} units of fibre and \param{TotalIron} mg of iron, how many cups of each should the nurses schedule to maximize the seniors’ total caloric intake?

parameters.definition: Units of fibre in a cup of spinach
Milligrams of iron in a cup of spinach
Calories in a cup of spinach
Units of fibre in a cup of soybeans
Milligrams of iron in a cup of soybeans
Calories in a cup of soybeans
Total minimum required units of fibre
Total minimum required milligrams of iron
